title.narrative: Flow control to mitigate fatigue load through the use of flexible tidal turbine blades

description.narrative: The project is a feasibility study on the use of flexible blades to increase the durability and survivability of tidal turbines. The highly turbulent flow experienced by tidal turbines leads to continuous load variations limiting the fatigue endurance. It is proposed to use flexible blades in order to control the flow field around the blades and allow constant stresses on the turbine's blades and shaft. Under the effect of a variation of the onset flow velocity at a certain location along the blade span, the flexible blade will change the local angle of attack and the foil shape. The new flow field around the blade section will be as such to minimise the load change on the blade section. The reduced, if not completely avoided, load variations will enhance the fatigue endurance of the blade and the shaft.

capital-spend.percentage: Obj.1: Develop an in-depth understanding of the flow field around a tidal turbine blade and the pressure distributions on the blade in highly-turbulent flow conditions Obj.2: Provide experimental proof of concept that flexible blades can lead to a lower stress variations Obj.3: Develop a numerical model able to predict the stresses on blades with different flexibility and to run in real-time in order to feed an active control system of the blade flexibility
